title: This is why, I hate playing support

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
That's a game where the only death was out of an execute (i tanked around 5 turret hits, and this kept my adc alive, while he got a kill, and i needed to go back in base anyway).
I'm involved in 14 out of 22 kills....... which were like almost all jhin's kills (i missed on one of his), and the rest happened on the other side of the map. I'm not shen, I can't tp around for assists when team makes plays without support.

My wards helped us kill the enemy a bunch of times, but nobody cares about that, right?
The build is pure utility (minus boots).
I roamed around to help different team members, leaving Jhin in a good lane where he snowballed hard with lots of CS under turret = safe


I mean COME ON. Do I have to build pure AP for an S rank?
I played almost perfectly that game.
I hit all my ults, I had good wards, both of us did a great job of harassing the enemy bot lane, just look at Vayne's farm...
We had full control over objectives (3 infernos), and I even participated in all of them.
My damage was just short by 300 outside of Nocturen's, Yasuo's and Kennen's. 
Almost double of Vayne and no lets not mention janna.

Why would I even play support ever again?
nothing what I do gets recognized by rito themselves >.<
#always troll when you get support from now on

replies.body:
> Why would I even play support ever again?
nothing what I do gets recognized by rito themselves >.<
>
always troll when you get support from now on

Alternatively, you can practice Support and get adept at being where you're needed. You can even play Soraka or Shen and help out when on the other side of the map (yes, Shen does work as a Support).

i don't like the idea of being on the other side of the map just because half of my team is doing a play there
someone needs to protect the part of my team that's on the side of the map without a fight

if 3 of my guys are diving top or mid, I don't want to waste ult for just an assist otherwise rito won't give S rank and recognize good play >.>
who cares you protect your turret, you get first turret blood, or even worse GIVE IT TO YOUR ADC >.< nooooooooooo, you must be penalized for that
Don't worry about making bad decisions to get an S, that is not how you get an S. Focus on actually making the right choices and you will be rewarded.
what if, the reward i'm looking for is the S rank owo ?

> if 3 of my guys are diving top or mid, I don't want to waste ult for just an assist otherwise rito won't give S rank and recognize good play

I'm saying you're not going to get good scores by throwing the match with shitty plays like using an ult on one person that didn't need it for an assist. Focus on improving and the scores will come naturally.

the game was literally perfect, we literally carried the entire team though the early, mid and late game
together

like, I really can't do better than that :(
that's why even the end time was 24 minutes, we were about to take all 3 inhibs down from the enemy when they surrendered (I assisted noct this time on top, while the 3 others fought and took bot).
like, there's no way i could've done anything better than going full ap :(

Sometimes the best you can do is still not enough. You aren't being measured against the other players in that match, but against other players' performance on the same champion in the same role overall.

The fact that they surrendered may have had a major influence on your score; if you'd been able to take the inhibs first that may have been what you needed.

DARN YOU ENEMIES!!!!!!!!
WHY DID YOU SURRENDER@!@!@!@!!!!!?????????

Now seriously. Would you play a game when the enemy carries got almost double your gold and 3 inferno drakes on their side and about to lose all your inhibs (you already lost one) and you got no vision outside your base coz the sona made sure there's no vision outside ?

I'm salty that it couldn't have been any better in that scenario :(
the enemy team was perfectly "suffocated" of their resources and vision. The only way it could've gone better was if the enemy Zed wouldn't have got a bunch of kills on bot, top and jungle and even bot in the early game.

Like, it was perfect, and nobody flamed anybody despite the fact that zed was like 7/3 by 10 minutes. And we stomped bot lane so hard that even after getting ganked multiple times, we only lost jhin twice.

after reading like 3 times i found out the point of this topic, S

as a 4 year support main, i have lv6 or 7 on almost all tanks supports and ultil champs.
sometimes, its hard, you cant take cs nor kills. heres some tips.
1:try to survive in all situations
2:participate as much as you can
3:warding is important, but not key to getting an S, dont risk your 1800 hp bar to ward
4: take all free cs, most of the time you are in a team fight, but if you got the oppertunity, take all free cs
5: dont complain, just move on
 hope u get thatshiy

I have a Mastery 7 on Sona. You need, at least, 20 or more assists. I noticed the game is short too, ending only at 24 minutes, the longer the game is, the better chance of getting a better ranking. Continue to ward a lot and destroy wards and continue to assist your fellow team whenever they're about to fight.

q.q
thank you
so, totally dominating and chocking your enemy won't get good results even tho it helps you end the game very easy 
thx again

> always troll when you get support from now on

Hope you get banned. One less toxic baby in my games

Universal advice of git gud.

Also some tips from a support main (and Sona enthusiast):

1. Generally need like 20+ assists unless the game is really short.
2. 50% Kill participation minimum (Shoot for like 66%-75% though).
3. CS doesn't really matter. 
4. KSing 2-3 kill will usually seal the deal.

See attached image, it's not that hard. Especially with Sona.
